means: 抱偏见的人，执拗的人，心胸狭窄的人

sentence.Network_en: His words stamped him to be a bigot.
sentence.Network_cn: 他讲的话表明他是个偏执的人.

sentence.Network_en: Henry was more than a bigot. He was also a hypocrite.
sentence.Network_cn: 亨利不只是一个顽固执拗的人, 他还是个伪君子.

sentence.Network_en: So you only act like a bigot and a sexist pig around me?
sentence.Network_cn: 那就让你在我面前表现的像头盲目自大的猪?

list.abs: Even outside ex - Yugoslavia , authoritarian and bigoted ideas still haunt the political fringe ., 即使在前南地区以外 , 极权主义与偏执观念仍萦绕在政治生活的边缘.
a bigoted person ; an outrageously bigoted viewpoint .一个偏执的人；一个异常偏执的观点
objective : to observe effect of treating bigoted facial paralysis plum-blossom needle and embedding catgut .目的：观察梅花针配合埋线治疗顽固性面瘫的临床疗效。
I ' m afraid , i am still so bigoted and stubborn ., 我害怕 , 我依旧那么偏执 , 固执.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (denoting a superstitious religious hypocrite): from French, of unknown origin

entry.tran: 固执的人；执拗的人；顽固不化的人
entry.def: If you describe someone as a bigot, you mean that they are bigoted.

means.word_mean: 1. a prejudiced person who is intolerant of any opinions differing from his own

zeal热心+ot……人→n.狂热分子,热心者
